litw-study-title: Is your perception more Eastern or Western?
litw-study-description-p1: Test how your cultural background influences the way you perceive information and compare yourself to others!
litw-study-description-p3: Click the button below to get started!
litw-irb2-header: Before we get started, here are a few things you should know...
litw-irb2-q1: What is this study all about?
litw-irb2-a1-p1: In this study, you'll be able to find out how your cultural background influences how you use and see technology. By doing this research, we hope to improve access to digital technology for diverse people. Our research is supported by the National Science Foundation.
litw-irb2-a1-p2: We’ll ask you questions about your demographics, experiences, and about your decision-making. You can then see how you compare to other people around the world! Altogether, this will take around
litw-irb2-q2: What data are we going to collect?
litw-irb2-a2: We will not collect your name and contact information. However, we will collect the city and country you are located in, what browser you are using, your answers to our questions, and data about how you use our website. We will securely store this data.
litw-irb2-q3: Do I have to be in this study?
litw-irb2-a3: No, being in this study is up to you. You can leave now or at any time later.
litw-irb2-q4: Who you can contact if you have questions?
litw-irb2-a4-p1: If you have questions or concerns, you may contact Professor Katharina Reinecke, Paul G. Allen Center for Computer Science & Engineering, Box 352350, Seattle, WA 98195, reinecke@cs.washington.edu.
litw-irb2-a4-p2: If you want to talk about the study with someone who is not part of the study team, contact the University of Washington Human Subjects Division at: hsdinfo@uw.edu or 206.543.0098. (for international calls include the US Calling Code: +1-206-543-0098).
litw-irb2-consent: I agree to participate in this research.
litw-irb-warning: You must check the box to continue.
litw-demographics-title: Please tell us a little bit about yourself.
litw-demographics-required: To proceed, please properly answer all fields below. (The ones marked with * are mandatory.)
litw-demographics-title-tip: We need this information for data analysis. Please note that none of the answers are personally identifiable. We take your privacy very seriously. You may email us at info@labinthewild.org for more information.
litw-demographics-minor-alert1: Sorry, we currently do not have approval from our Institutional Review Board to conduct this study with minors younger than 14 years old.
litw-demographics-minor-alert2: In five seconds, we're redirecting you to our home page where you can participate in other studies.
litw-demographics-retake: Have you taken this test before?
litw-demographics-country-grow: Which country did you live the longest growing up?
litw-demographics-country-live: Which country do you currently live in?
litw-demographics-religion: What religion or religious denomination do you belong to?
litw-demographics-education: What is your highest level of formal education?
litw-demographics-education4: Incomplete secondary school or high school
litw-demographics-education5: Complete secondary school or high school
litw-demographics-country: What country are you from? (If you have lived in several countries, please indicate the country you have lived in longest.)
litw-demographics-culture: Which country is most representative of your cultural background?
litw-demographics-culture-tip: For most people, this will be the country they were born in and probably still live in.
litw-demographics-race-islander: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
litw-comment-subtitle: Before you continue to your results, please let us know what you thought of the study!
litw-comment-q1: Do you have any comments for the researcher? Questions, Suggestions, or Concerns?
litw-comment-q21: Did you encounter any technical difficulties during this study?
litw-comment-q31: Did you cheat or in any way provide false information?
litw-comment-email-p1: You can also email us at
study-fl-instruct-alert-p1-absolute: Please pay close attention to the instructions for drawing a line at the exact length, independent of the size of the frame.
study-fl-instruct-alert-p2-absolute: ATTENTION, the following instructions are for drawing the line at the exact length, independent of the size of the frame.
study-fl-instruct-alert-p1-relative: Please pay close attention to the instructions for drawing a line RELATIVE to the size of the frame.
study-fl-instruct-alert-p2-relative: ATTENTION, the following instructions are for drawing a line RELATIVE to the size of the frame.
study-fl-instruct-intro1-p1: 1: In this test, you first be shown a frame with a line inside of it.
study-fl-instruct-intro2-p1: 1: Same as before, you first be shown a frame with a line inside of it.
study-fl-instruct-intro1-p2: 2: After 5 seconds, you will see a frame of a different size. In this second frame, please draw a new line using the up/down arrows on the keyboard or screen.
study-fl-instruct-intro2-p2: 2: Again you will wait 5 seconds for a different frame where you will draw your response.
study-fl-instruct-intro1-p3-relative: 3: Your response line should have the same proportional length to the frame as you previously saw.
study-fl-instruct-intro2-p3-relative: 3: This time around, your line should have the same proportional length to the frame as you previously saw.
study-fl-instruct-intro1-p3-absolute: 3: Your response line should have the same length as the first line, independent of the size of the frame.
study-fl-instruct-intro2-p3-absolute: 3: This time around, your line should have the same length as the first line, independent of the size of the frame.
study-fl-instruct-intro-p4: Click the arrow below when you're ready to practice!
study-fl-instruct-examples-relative: In the examples above, the left one is correct because it keeps the PROPORTIONAL size of the line -- half of the frame. The line on the right is wrong because it has a larger proportion than the original.
study-fl-instruct-examples-absolute: In the examples above, the left one is correct because it keeps the SAME LENGTH of the line REGARDLESS the size of the frame. The line on the right is wrong simply because the drawn line is smaller than the original.
study-fl-instruct-keys_1: In drawing lines, hold down the DOWN-ARROW key on your keyboard or click the down button to draw the line. Hold down the UP-ARROW or click the up button for adjustments. When you are done, click the DONE button to submit your answer.
study-fl-instruct-keys_2: As before, hold down the DOWN-ARROW key on your keyboard or click the down button to draw the line. Hold down the UP-ARROW or click the up button for adjustments. When you are done, click the DONE button to submit your answer.
study-fl-practice-results-good: Great! It definitely seems like you understand the task.
study-fl-practice-results-bad: Too high of an error! Maybe you should try again.
study-fl-practice-p1: Please do not use your finger or any device to measure the lengths of the lines. Otherwise the exercise becomes pointless.
study-fl-practice-p2-relative: Prepare to draw a line that has the same RELATIVE length of the one you see below.
study-fl-practice-p2-absolute: Prepare to draw a line that has the same ABSOLUTE length of the one you see below.
study-fl-practice-p3: Use the keyboard DOWN-ARROW key or the button on the right to draw a line. You may also use the UP-ARROW key or button on the left for length adjustment.
study-fl-practice-done-p1: Now, you will perform a number of trials in a row. Please perform the task as accurately as possible.
study-fl-practice-done-p2: When you are ready, please press the NEXT arrow below.
study-fl-practice-p6: On the left is the original line, on the right is the line you drew.
study-fl-practice-p7-relative: Remember, draw a line that has the same RELATIVE length to the frame size as in the first one.
study-fl-practice-p7-absolute: Remember, draw a line that has the same ABSOLUTE length as the first one, regardless of the size of the frame.
study-fl-practice-p8: Are you ready for another practice trial? If so, please press XX to start.
study-fl-results-header1-absolute: Your visual perception is more Westerner than Easterner!
study-fl-results-header1-relative: Your visual perception is more Easterner than Westerner!
study-fl-results-header2-absolute: You did better in the absolute tasks, which is connected to a more analytic* visual perception. This is more prevalent among Westerners.
study-fl-results-header2-relative: You did better in the relative tasks, which is connected to a more holistic* visual perception. This is more prevalent among Easterners.
study-fl-results-details-relative: Your relative lines were off by:
study-fl-results-details-absolute: Meanwhile, your absolute lines were off by:
study-fl-results-relative: Your relative lines were off by:
study-fl-results-absolute: Meanwhile, your absolute lines were off by:
study-fl-results-more: Here is how much your lines where apart from the expected ones.
study-fl-results-explanation-analytic: If you were better at drawing the line independent of the size of the frame, you may tend to be more analytic, which means you may focus more on the foreground elements of a scene.
study-fl-results-explanation-holistic: If you were better at the relative task, you may tend to have a holistic mindset, paying close attention to contextual elements and their relation with foreground elements.
study-fl-results-citation: The Frame-Line test was originally created and published by:
study-fl-results-citation1: Kitayama, Shinobu et al. “Perceiving an Object and Its Context in Different Cultures.” Psychological Science 14 (2003): 201 - 206.
litw-more-title: If you enjoyed this study, there's more!
litw-more-step1: Visit and follow us on Facebook to learn about new studies:
litw-more-step2: Share this study with your friends!
litw-more-step3: And consider participating in some of our other studies:
litw-more-study1-slogan: How well can AI understand your speech?
litw-more-study1-description: Find out how well AI can understand your speech by reading out loud a few words and sentences! The test takes around 7 minutes.
litw-more-study2-slogan: Learn to be a better writer!
litw-more-study2-description: Can you identify the writing strategies of experts? Improve your reading and writing while comparing yourself to experts in this 10 minute study!
